primary.text:
Creating new dialogues 
between threads and metal

primary.label: Jewellery Care
description: All FLOEMA jewels are exclusively realized using precious metals: 925 silver (pure for the Filigree) and 18kt gold. All melals are subjecied to a natural oxidation process that depends either on natural factors like oxygen in the air the salt in the sea sunlight skin ph or on chemical factors like creams and perfumes.
Please find two ways to clean gold and silver with neutral ingredients.
To make your piece return to its original condition:
Gold is slightly subjected to the oxidation process. To make vour iewel shine at ain put vour iewels in a solution or half cup of white vinegar and salt for at least 30 minutes
With a white cotton soft cloth dipped in the solution first brush your piece and then rinse it with plenty of water and voila!
To take the oxidation off silver you have to use one ingredient only: bicarbonate

Pour 250ml bicarbonate in a container. Mixed until it is melted. Leave your silver iewels in the solution over the night. Then brush them with a toothbrush until they shine again. Finally, rinse and dry with soft cloth.

The suprise of which is possible
 to make a simple

primary.label: Sustainability
description: All FLOEMA jewels are exclusively realized using precious metals: 925 silver (pure for the Filigree) and 18kt gold. All melals are subjecied to a natural oxidation process that depends either on natural factors like oxygen in the air the salt in the sea sunlight skin ph or on chemical factors like creams and perfumes.
Please find two ways to clean gold and silver with neutral ingredients.
You will receive each piece in a handmade box realized by Florentine typography using eco-friendly paper (made by 90% of pure cellulose and 10% by cotton fibers),
in a recycled and 100% recyclable parcel.
The business cards are realized with recycled cotton fiber cardboard.
All the pieces are created in a small laboratory in the Florentine countryside, preferring using green materials and recycling precious materials.
